gw.wsi.pl

Class ImportToolsAPI

  • gw.wsi.pl.ImportToolsAPI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    _proxy_.gw.lang.reflect.gs.IGosuObject

    public class ImportToolsAPI
implements _proxy_.gw.lang.reflect.gs.IGosuObject
    ImportToolsAPI is a remote interface to a set of tools to import XML data to the server.

    The XML import format is defined by dynamically-generated XML Schema Definition (XSD) files. Regenerate the XSD files with the regen-xsd task. After XSD regeneration, you will find the XSD files in dist/xsd/import, including the three XSD files: xx_typelists.xsd, xx_entities.xsd, xx_import.xsd (with "xx" replaced by the Guidewire product code, e.g., "cc" for ClaimCenter).

      ImportResults importArchiveXmlData(String xmlData)
      Import XML data, the string must be utf-8. Note that importing data through this call does not generate events for the newly imported objects. WARNING: this is only supported for administrative database tables (such as User) because these XML import routines do not perform complete data validation tests on imported data. Any other use (claims, policies, etc) is dangerous and is NOT supported
      ImportResults importArchiveXmlDataAsByteArray(byte[] xmlData)
      Import XML data, passing the data as an array of UTF-8 bytes representing the XML string. To improve performance, the XML data string can be wrapped with CDATA tags. For example: <![CDATA[
      ...import XML...
      ]]> Note that importing data through this call does not generate events for the newly imported objects. WARNING: this is only supported for administrative database tables (such as User) because these XML import routines do not perform complete data validation tests on imported data. Any other use (claims, policies, etc) is dangerous and is NOT supported @see #importXmlData(String)
      ImportResults importCsvData(String csvData, int dataSet, boolean ignoreNullConstraintViolations, boolean ignoreAllErrors)
      Import CSV data. Note that importing data through this call does not generate events for the newly imported objects. WARNING: this is only supported for administrative database tables (such as User) because these XML import routines do not perform complete data validation tests on imported data. Any other use (claims, policies, etc) is dangerous and is NOT supported
      ImportResults importXml(gw.xml.XmlElement xml)
      Import XML. This will either import from xml conforming to either archive's import xsd, or from xx_import xsd. This is an inefficient process, since the xml will be writen out and reparsed by sax. But it can make the determination of which import to use, based solely on xml. Note that importing data through this call does not generate events for the newly imported objects. WARNING: this is only supported for administrative database tables (such as User) because these XML import routines do not perform complete data validation tests on imported data. Any other use (claims, policies, etc) is dangerous and is NOT supported

Any other use (claims, policies, etc) is dangerous and is NOT supported

    • Method Detail

      • importXml

        ImportResults importXml(gw.xml.XmlElement xml)
        Import XML. This will either import from xml conforming to either archive's import xsd, or from xx_import xsd. This is an inefficient process, since the xml will be writen out and reparsed by sax. But it can make the determination of which import to use, based solely on xml. Note that importing data through this call does not generate events for the newly imported objects.

        WARNING: this is only supported for administrative database tables (such as User) because these XML import routines do not perform complete data validation tests on imported data. Any other use (claims, policies, etc) is dangerous and is NOT supported

        Parameters:
        xml - The data to import. This may not be null or empty.
        Returns:
        Set of results of the import (number of entities imported by type, and so on). If the import failed, ImportResults will have the ok flag set to false, and the errorLog element will contain descriptions of the errors that were encountered.

      • importArchiveXmlData

        ImportResults importArchiveXmlData(String xmlData)
        Import XML data, the string must be utf-8. Note that importing data through this call does not generate events for the newly imported objects.

        WARNING: this is only supported for administrative database tables (such as User) because these XML import routines do not perform complete data validation tests on imported data. Any other use (claims, policies, etc) is dangerous and is NOT supported

        Parameters:
        xmlData - The data to import, passed as a String. This may not be null or empty.
        Returns:
        Set of results of the import (number of entities imported by type, and so on). If the import failed, ImportResults will have the ok flag set to false, and the errorLog element will contain descriptions of the errors that were encountered.

      • importArchiveXmlDataAsByteArray

        ImportResults importArchiveXmlDataAsByteArray(byte[] xmlData)
        Import XML data, passing the data as an array of UTF-8 bytes representing the XML string. To improve performance, the XML data string can be wrapped with CDATA tags. For example: 
        <![CDATA[
        
...import XML...
        
]]>
        Note that importing data through this call does not generate events for the newly imported objects.

        WARNING: this is only supported for administrative database tables (such as User) because these XML import routines do not perform complete data validation tests on imported data. Any other use (claims, policies, etc) is dangerous and is NOT supported @see #importXmlData(String)

        Parameters:
        xmlData - The data to import, passed as a byte[] for the UTF-8 bytes representing the XML string. This may not be null or empty.
        Returns:
        Set of results of the import (number of entities imported by type, and so on). If the import failed, ImportResults will have the ok flag set to false, and the errorLog element will contain descriptions of the errors that were encountered.

      • importXmlData

        ImportResults importXmlData(String xmlData)
        Import XML data. To improve performance, the XML data string can be wrapped with CDATA tags. For example: 
        <![CDATA[
        
...import XML...
        
]]>
        Note that importing data through this call does not generate events for the newly imported objects.

        WARNING: this is only supported for administrative database tables (such as User) because these XML import routines do not perform complete data validation tests on imported data. Any other use (claims, policies, etc) is dangerous and is NOT supported

        Parameters:
        xmlData - The data to import, passed as a String. This may not be null or empty.
        Returns:
        Set of results of the import (number of entities imported by type, and so on). If the import failed, ImportResults will have the ok flag set to false, and the errorLog element will contain descriptions of the errors that were encountered.

      • importXmlDataAsByteArray

        ImportResults importXmlDataAsByteArray(byte[] xmlData)
        Import XML data, passing the data as an array of UTF-8 bytes representing the XML string. To improve performance, the XML data string can be wrapped with CDATA tags. For example: 
        <![CDATA[
        
...import XML...
        
]]>
        Note that importing data through this call does not generate events for the newly imported objects.

        WARNING: this is only supported for administrative database tables (such as User) because these XML import routines do not perform complete data validation tests on imported data. Any other use (claims, policies, etc) is dangerous and is NOT supported @see #importXmlData(String)

        Parameters:
        xmlData - The data to import, passed as a byte[] for the UTF-8 bytes representing the XML string. This may not be null or empty.
        Returns:
        Set of results of the import (number of entities imported by type, and so on). If the import failed, ImportResults will have the ok flag set to false, and the errorLog element will contain descriptions of the errors that were encountered.

      • importCsvData

        ImportResults importCsvData(String csvData,
                          int dataSet,
                          boolean ignoreNullConstraintViolations,
                          boolean ignoreAllErrors)
        Import CSV data. Note that importing data through this call does not generate events for the newly imported objects.

        WARNING: this is only supported for administrative database tables (such as User) because these XML import routines do not perform complete data validation tests on imported data. Any other use (claims, policies, etc) is dangerous and is NOT supported

        Parameters:
        csvData - The data to import, passed as a String. This may not be null.
        dataSet -
        ignoreNullConstraintViolations -
        ignoreAllErrors -
        Returns:
        Set of results of the import (number of entities imported by type, and so on). If the import failed, ImportResults will have the ok flag set to false, and the errorLog element will contain descriptions of the errors that were encountered.

      • csvToXml

        String csvToXml(String csvData,
              int dataSet,
              boolean ignoreNullConstraintViolations,
              boolean ignoreAllErrors)
        Convert CSV data to XML data suitable to be imported {@link #importXmlData(String)}
        Parameters:
        csvData - A String containing CSV data
        dataSet - An int defining the number of the dataset to be imported. Datasets are ordered by inclusion, and the smallest dataset is always numbered 0. Thus Dataset 0 is a subset of dataset 1, and datatset 1 is a subset of dataset 2, etc. If this param is set to -1, all data will be imported.
        ignoreNullConstraintViolations - Whether to continue after detecting an empty field in the CSV that corresponds to a property that is not nullable. If false, throws an exception in this situation.
        ignoreAllErrors -
        Returns:
        a String containing equivalent import data in XML format, suitable for import by #importXmlData(String)

      • xmlToCsv

        String xmlToCsv(String xmlData)
        Export XML data into CSV data. The reverse operation from #csvToXml(String)
        Parameters:
        xmlData - String containing CSV data
        Returns:
        a String containing equivalent import data in CSV format. The result of calling csvToXml on the result should be an equivalent XML document to #xmlData.

      • rebuildRolePrivileges

        void rebuildRolePrivileges()
        Rebuild the role privileges data by deleting the priviliges data in the database, and then re-importing the roleprivileges.csv file.
